tasks.title: Project Setup and Repository Configuration
tasks.description: Initialize the project repository with Next.js, TypeScript, and necessary configurations for frontend and backend development.
tasks.details:
1. Create a monorepo structure using Turborepo or NX for managing frontend and backend
2. Initialize Next.js 14 with App Router for frontend using `npx create-next-app@latest` with TypeScript
3. Set up Express.js backend with TypeScript using `npm init -y && npm install express typescript @types/express ts-node nodemon`
4. Configure ESLint and Prettier for code quality
5. Set up Git hooks with Husky for pre-commit linting
6. Initialize Docker configuration with docker-compose.yml for local development
7. Create basic CI/CD pipeline configuration using GitHub Actions or GitLab CI
8. Set up environment variables management with dotenv
9. Configure VSCode settings for consistent developer experience
10. Document repository structure and setup instructions in README.md
tasks.testStrategy: Verify project initialization by running build scripts and ensuring all configurations work correctly. Test Docker setup by building and running containers locally.

subtasks.title: Initialize Monorepo Structure
subtasks.description: Set up the foundational monorepo using a version control system (e.g., Git), create the initial directory structure, and configure workspaces if needed.
subtasks.details: Run `git init`, create logical directories for frontend, backend, and shared code, and configure package managers (npm/yarn workspaces or Lerna) for dependency management.

subtasks.title: Document Monorepo Structure and Best Practices
subtasks.description: Create documentation outlining the monorepo's structure, dependency management approach, and contribution guidelines.
subtasks.details: Write a README detailing directory layout, workspace usage, and do's and don'ts for working in the monorepo.

subtasks.title: Set Up Next.js Application
subtasks.description: Create and configure the Next.js frontend application within the monorepo.
subtasks.details: Use `npx create-next-app` or similar, ensure it is placed in the correct directory, and configure workspace dependencies.

subtasks.title: Set Up Express Backend Application
subtasks.description: Create and configure the Express backend application within the monorepo.
subtasks.details: Initialize an Express app, set up its dependencies, and ensure it is integrated into the monorepo structure.

subtasks.title: Configure ESLint for Monorepo
subtasks.description: Set up ESLint at the root and for each project, ensuring consistent linting rules across frontend and backend.
subtasks.details: Install ESLint, create shared and project-specific configs, and add lint scripts to each package.

subtasks.title: Document Linting Standards and Usage
subtasks.description: Document how to run and fix linting issues, and outline the linting standards enforced in the monorepo.
subtasks.details: Update the README or create a dedicated linting guide with instructions and troubleshooting tips.

subtasks.title: Add Docker Support for Each Application
subtasks.description: Create Dockerfiles and docker-compose configuration for both Next.js and Express apps.
subtasks.details: Write Dockerfiles for each app, set up a docker-compose.yml at the root, and ensure services can be built and run together.

subtasks.title: Document Docker Usage and Local Development
subtasks.description: Provide documentation on building, running, and troubleshooting Docker containers for the monorepo.
subtasks.details: Add instructions to the README or a dedicated Docker guide, including common commands and environment variable setup.

subtasks.title: Set Up CI/CD Pipeline for Monorepo
subtasks.description: Configure automated CI/CD workflows to build, test, and deploy each application independently.
subtasks.details: Use a CI/CD tool (e.g., GitHub Actions, CircleCI) to set up workflows that trigger on changes, run lint/tests, and build/deploy Docker images.

subtasks.title: Verify and Document CI/CD Processes
subtasks.description: Test the CI/CD pipeline, ensure all steps work as intended, and document the process for future contributors.
subtasks.details: Run test deployments, validate build/test steps, and update documentation with pipeline details and troubleshooting.

tasks.title: Frontend Foundation with Next.js and Tailwind CSS
tasks.description: Set up the frontend architecture with Next.js, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS with responsive design principles.
tasks.details:
1. Configure Tailwind CSS 3.3+ with Next.js
2. Set up dark/light theme toggle using next-themes package
3. Implement responsive layout components using Tailwind's mobile-first approach
4. Create base component library (buttons, inputs, cards, modals)
5. Set up folder structure following Next.js best practices:
   - app/ (for App Router)
   - components/ (shared components)
   - lib/ (utility functions)
   - styles/ (global styles)
   - types/ (TypeScript interfaces)
6. Configure PWA capabilities with next-pwa package
7. Implement i18n using next-intl for multi-language support
8. Set up accessibility compliance tools (axe-core) and implement WCAG 2.1 AA standards
9. Create global state management with React Context API or Zustand
10. Implement responsive navigation and layout components
tasks.testStrategy: Use Storybook to test UI components in isolation. Implement Jest and React Testing Library for component testing. Use Lighthouse and axe for accessibility testing. Test responsive design across multiple device viewports.

subtasks.title: Tailwind CSS Setup
subtasks.description: Install and configure Tailwind CSS, ensuring integration with the project's build system and frameworks.
subtasks.details: Set up Tailwind CSS using the recommended installation method for the framework (e.g., Next.js). Configure the tailwind.config.js file, define content paths, and ensure JIT mode is enabled for optimal performance.

subtasks.title: Tailwind Theming and Customization
subtasks.description: Extend Tailwind's default theme to include custom colors, fonts, and design tokens for brand consistency.
subtasks.details: Modify tailwind.config.js to add custom color palettes, spacing, and typography. Group design tokens semantically for maintainability.

subtasks.title: Tailwind Component Library Architecture
subtasks.description: Design and implement a reusable component library using Tailwind utility classes.
subtasks.details: Create a set of core UI components (e.g., buttons, forms, cards) styled with Tailwind. Ensure components are composable and follow DRY principles.

subtasks.title: Progressive Web App (PWA) Setup
subtasks.description: Configure the project as a PWA with offline support, manifest, and service worker.
subtasks.details: Add a web app manifest, configure service workers, and ensure the app meets PWA installability criteria.

subtasks.title: Internationalization (i18n) Integration
subtasks.description: Implement internationalization support for multiple languages.
subtasks.details: Set up an i18n library (e.g., react-i18next), define translation files, and ensure all UI text is translatable.

subtasks.title: Accessibility (a11y) Implementation
subtasks.description: Ensure all components and pages meet accessibility standards (WCAG).
subtasks.details: Audit components for keyboard navigation, ARIA attributes, color contrast, and screen reader support.

subtasks.title: State Management Architecture
subtasks.description: Select and implement a state management solution suitable for the app's complexity.
subtasks.details: Choose a state management library (e.g., Redux, Zustand, Context API), set up global state, and document usage patterns.

subtasks.title: Navigation Structure Setup
subtasks.description: Implement a robust navigation system with routing and deep linking.
subtasks.details: Configure routing (e.g., Next.js App Router), set up navigation components, and ensure accessibility for navigation elements.

subtasks.title: Testing: Tailwind and Component Library
subtasks.description: Write unit and integration tests for Tailwind-based components.
subtasks.details: Use a testing framework (e.g., Jest, React Testing Library) to verify component rendering, styling, and interaction.

subtasks.title: Testing: PWA, i18n, and Accessibility
subtasks.description: Test PWA features, language switching, and accessibility compliance.
subtasks.details: Use Lighthouse for PWA and a11y audits, and test language switching across supported locales.

subtasks.title: Testing: State Management and Navigation
subtasks.description: Test state transitions and navigation flows.
subtasks.details: Write tests to ensure correct state updates and navigation between routes, including edge cases.

subtasks.title: Documentation for Architecture and Features
subtasks.description: Document setup, usage, and best practices for all architectural and feature implementations.
subtasks.details: Create comprehensive documentation covering Tailwind setup, theming, component usage, PWA configuration, i18n, accessibility, state management, navigation, and testing strategies.

tasks.title: Backend API Architecture with Express and TypeScript
tasks.description: Establish the backend architecture using Node.js, Express, and TypeScript with a microservices approach.
tasks.details:
1. Set up Express.js server with TypeScript
2. Implement microservices architecture using:
   - API Gateway pattern with Express
   - Service discovery with Consul or etcd
   - Message broker with RabbitMQ or Kafka for service communication
3. Configure middleware for:
   - CORS handling
   - Request parsing
   - Authentication
   - Error handling
   - Logging (using Winston or Pino)
4. Set up RESTful API routes with versioning (e.g., /api/v1/)
5. Implement GraphQL with Apollo Server for complex queries
6. Configure rate limiting with express-rate-limit
7. Set up DDoS protection with rate limiters and Cloudflare integration
8. Implement API documentation with Swagger/OpenAPI using swagger-jsdoc and swagger-ui-express
9. Configure health check endpoints
10. Implement graceful shutdown handling
tasks.testStrategy: Use Jest for unit testing API endpoints. Implement integration tests with Supertest. Set up API contract testing with Pact. Use load testing with Artillery to verify rate limiting and performance.

subtasks.title: API Gateway Selection and Setup
subtasks.description: Research, select, and provision an API gateway solution suitable for the microservices architecture. Document the rationale and initial configuration.
subtasks.details: Deliverable: Decision document and initial gateway setup.

subtasks.title: API Gateway Routing Configuration
subtasks.description: Define and implement routing rules in the API gateway to direct requests to appropriate microservices based on path, method, and headers.
subtasks.details: Deliverable: Routing configuration files and test cases.

subtasks.title: API Gateway Security Implementation
subtasks.description: Implement authentication and authorization mechanisms (e.g., JWT, API keys, RBAC) in the API gateway.
subtasks.details: Deliverable: Security configuration and test results.

subtasks.title: Microservices Design and Implementation
subtasks.description: Design and implement individual microservices with clear responsibilities and interfaces.
subtasks.details: Deliverable: Source code and API specifications for each microservice.

subtasks.title: Service Discovery Integration
subtasks.description: Integrate service discovery (e.g., Eureka, Consul) so the API gateway can dynamically locate microservice instances.
subtasks.details: Deliverable: Service registry setup and gateway integration.

subtasks.title: Middleware Implementation
subtasks.description: Develop and integrate middleware for logging, monitoring, and request/response transformation across the gateway and microservices.
subtasks.details: Deliverable: Middleware modules and integration tests.

subtasks.title: REST Endpoint Development
subtasks.description: Design and implement RESTful endpoints for each microservice, ensuring adherence to best practices.
subtasks.details: Deliverable: REST API endpoints and OpenAPI specifications.

subtasks.title: GraphQL Endpoint Development
subtasks.description: Design and implement GraphQL endpoints where appropriate, including schema definition and resolvers.
subtasks.details: Deliverable: GraphQL schemas and endpoint implementations.

subtasks.title: Rate Limiting Configuration
subtasks.description: Configure rate limiting in the API gateway to prevent abuse and ensure fair usage.
subtasks.details: Deliverable: Rate limiting rules and validation tests.

subtasks.title: API Documentation Generation
subtasks.description: Generate and publish comprehensive API documentation for both REST and GraphQL endpoints.
subtasks.details: Deliverable: API documentation (e.g., Swagger/OpenAPI, GraphQL Playground).

subtasks.title: Health Check Implementation
subtasks.description: Implement health check endpoints for each microservice and configure the API gateway to aggregate and expose health status.
subtasks.details: Deliverable: Health check endpoints and gateway aggregation logic.

subtasks.title: Graceful Shutdown Procedures
subtasks.description: Implement and document graceful shutdown procedures for the API gateway and all microservices to ensure reliability during deployments and failures.
subtasks.details: Deliverable: Shutdown scripts and operational runbooks.

tasks.title: Database Design and Implementation
tasks.description: Design and implement the database architecture to support user management, challenges, verifications, and other core features.
tasks.details:
1. Select appropriate database technologies:
   - PostgreSQL for relational data (users, challenges, verifications)
   - MongoDB for unstructured data (challenge submissions)
   - Redis for caching and real-time features
2. Design database schema with the following tables/collections:
   - Users (id, username, email, password_hash, role, reputation_score, etc.)
   - Challenges (id, creator_id, title, description, category, location, timeframe, reward, status, etc.)
   - Verifications (id, challenge_id, verifier_id, submission_data, status, etc.)
   - Transactions (id, user_id, amount, type, status, blockchain_tx_id, etc.)
   - Reputation (user_id, score, history, etc.)
3. Implement database migrations using Prisma or TypeORM
4. Set up data access layer with repositories pattern
5. Implement database indexing for performance optimization
6. Configure connection pooling for scalability
7. Implement data validation at the database level
8. Set up backup and recovery procedures
9. Implement database sharding strategy for horizontal scaling
10. Configure database monitoring and performance metrics
tasks.testStrategy: Create unit tests for database models and repositories. Implement integration tests for database operations. Use database performance testing tools to verify query optimization. Test database migrations and rollback procedures.

subtasks.title: Database Technology Selection
subtasks.description: Evaluate and select the most suitable database technology based on project requirements.
subtasks.details: Assess scalability, performance, data consistency, security, cost, and community support.

subtasks.title: Schema Design
subtasks.description: Create a logical and physical schema for the selected database technology.
subtasks.details: Define tables, relationships, and data types.

subtasks.title: Schema Validation
subtasks.description: Validate the schema against project requirements and data integrity rules.
subtasks.details: Check for consistency and potential errors.

subtasks.title: Database Migration Planning
subtasks.description: Plan the migration process from existing databases to the new technology.
subtasks.details: Identify data transformation needs and potential risks.

subtasks.title: Database Migration Execution
subtasks.description: Execute the migration plan, transferring data to the new database.
subtasks.details: Monitor for errors and ensure data integrity.

subtasks.title: Performance Optimization
subtasks.description: Optimize database performance by indexing, caching, and query tuning.
subtasks.details: Analyze query patterns and adjust configurations.

subtasks.title: Backup Strategy Development
subtasks.description: Develop a comprehensive backup strategy for data protection.
subtasks.details: Schedule regular backups and ensure recovery processes.

subtasks.title: Sharding Strategy Development
subtasks.description: Plan a sharding strategy to enhance scalability and performance.
subtasks.details: Determine shard keys and distribution methods.

subtasks.title: Sharding Implementation
subtasks.description: Implement the sharding strategy across the database.
subtasks.details: Configure and test shard distribution.

subtasks.title: Monitoring Setup
subtasks.description: Set up monitoring tools to track database performance and health.
subtasks.details: Configure alerts for critical issues.

subtasks.title: Data Validation Post-Migration
subtasks.description: Validate data integrity post-migration to ensure no data loss or corruption.
subtasks.details: Run checks for data consistency and accuracy.

subtasks.title: Ongoing Optimization and Maintenance
subtasks.description: Continuously monitor and optimize database performance and security.
subtasks.details: Regularly review logs, update configurations, and apply patches.

tasks.title: User Authentication and Authorization System
tasks.description: Implement a comprehensive user authentication and authorization system with multi-factor authentication and role-based access control.
tasks.details:
1. Implement JWT-based authentication using jsonwebtoken package
2. Set up OAuth 2.0 integration for social logins (Google, Twitter, GitHub)
3. Implement password hashing with bcrypt
4. Create role-based access control (RBAC) system with roles: Challenger, Verifier, Administrator
5. Implement multi-factor authentication using authenticator apps (e.g., with speakeasy)
6. Set up email verification flow using Nodemailer
7. Implement secure password reset functionality
8. Create session management with Redis
9. Implement JWT refresh token rotation for enhanced security
10. Set up user permission management system
11. Implement account lockout after failed login attempts
12. Create middleware for route protection based on user roles and permissions
tasks.testStrategy: Implement unit tests for authentication logic. Create integration tests for login, registration, and password reset flows. Perform security testing including penetration testing for authentication endpoints. Test role-based access control with different user types.

subtasks.title: Implement JWT Authentication
subtasks.description: Develop JWT-based authentication, ensuring secure token issuance, validation, and revocation. Include best practices for signing, expiration, and claim management.
subtasks.details: Follow security best practices such as validating JWT signatures, checking token expiration, and handling claims securely. Implement automated tests for signature validation, tampered payloads, and expired tokens.

subtasks.title: Implement OAuth Integration
subtasks.description: Integrate OAuth 2.0 for third-party authentication, supporting flows such as Authorization Code and Implicit Grant.
subtasks.details: Ensure secure handling of access tokens and refresh tokens. Test for common OAuth vulnerabilities, such as improper redirect URI validation and token leakage.

subtasks.title: Implement Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)
subtasks.description: Design and enforce RBAC policies to restrict access to resources based on user roles.
subtasks.details: Define roles and permissions, and implement middleware to enforce RBAC at the API level. Test for privilege escalation and bypass scenarios.

subtasks.title: Implement Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)
subtasks.description: Add support for MFA, requiring users to provide a second authentication factor during login.
subtasks.details: Support TOTP, SMS, or email-based codes. Test for bypass attempts and ensure secure code delivery and validation.

subtasks.title: Implement Email Verification
subtasks.description: Require users to verify their email addresses before activating their accounts.
subtasks.details: Send secure, expiring verification links. Test for link reuse, expiration, and unauthorized activation.

subtasks.title: Implement Password Reset Functionality
subtasks.description: Allow users to securely reset their passwords via email or SMS.
subtasks.details: Generate secure, single-use reset tokens with expiration. Test for token reuse, brute-force, and enumeration vulnerabilities.

subtasks.title: Implement Session Management
subtasks.description: Develop secure session management, including session creation, validation, and termination.
subtasks.details: Support session invalidation on logout and after password changes. Test for session fixation, hijacking, and timeout enforcement.

subtasks.title: Implement Account Lockout Mechanism
subtasks.description: Protect against brute-force attacks by locking accounts after repeated failed login attempts.
subtasks.details: Configure lockout thresholds and durations. Test for lockout bypass, denial-of-service, and notification mechanisms.

subtasks.title: Develop Authentication Middleware
subtasks.description: Create middleware to enforce authentication and authorization checks on protected routes.
subtasks.details: Ensure middleware validates JWTs, checks OAuth tokens, and enforces RBAC. Test for bypass and improper access control.

subtasks.title: Security Testing for JWT Implementation
subtasks.description: Perform comprehensive security testing on JWT handling, including signature validation and claim manipulation.
subtasks.details: Test for signature stripping, tampered payloads, expired tokens, and privilege escalation via claims.

subtasks.title: Security Testing for OAuth Integration
subtasks.description: Test OAuth flows for vulnerabilities such as token leakage, improper redirect URI handling, and CSRF.
subtasks.details: Simulate attacks on OAuth endpoints and validate secure handling of tokens and user data.

subtasks.title: Security Testing for RBAC
subtasks.description: Test RBAC enforcement for privilege escalation and unauthorized access.
subtasks.details: Attempt to access resources with insufficient permissions and verify correct enforcement.

subtasks.title: Security Testing for MFA, Email Verification, and Password Reset
subtasks.description: Test MFA, email verification, and password reset for bypass, replay, and enumeration vulnerabilities.
subtasks.details: Simulate attacks such as code reuse, expired links, and brute-force attempts.

subtasks.title: Security Testing for Session Management, Lockout, and Middleware
subtasks.description: Test session management, account lockout, and middleware for security flaws and bypasses.
subtasks.details: Check for session fixation, lockout bypass, and middleware misconfiguration.

tasks.title: XRP Ledger Integration with Crossmark SDK
tasks.description: Integrate the XRP Ledger using Crossmark SDK for wallet connectivity and transaction management.
tasks.details:
1. Integrate Crossmark SDK (latest version) for XRP Ledger wallet connectivity
2. Implement wallet connection and disconnection functionality
3. Create transaction signing and submission workflows
4. Set up XRP Ledger node connection for transaction validation
5. Implement transaction history tracking and display
6. Create wallet balance monitoring system
7. Set up webhook listeners for XRP Ledger events
8. Implement transaction fee estimation
9. Create transaction status monitoring system
10. Implement multi-signature wallet support for treasury management
11. Set up secure key management for platform wallets
12. Create transaction retry mechanism for failed transactions
tasks.testStrategy: Test wallet connection with Crossmark SDK using XRP Ledger Testnet. Implement unit tests for transaction creation and signing. Create integration tests for the complete transaction flow. Test multi-signature functionality with multiple signers.

subtasks.title: SDK Installation and Configuration
subtasks.description: Install the blockchain SDK and configure it for the target environment, ensuring compatibility with the application stack.
subtasks.details: Includes downloading the SDK, setting up environment variables, and verifying installation.

subtasks.title: SDK Initialization in Application
subtasks.description: Initialize the SDK within the application codebase, establishing the base for blockchain interactions.
subtasks.details: Set up SDK objects, configure network parameters, and ensure proper error handling for initialization failures.

subtasks.title: Wallet Integration Setup
subtasks.description: Integrate wallet provider(s) (e.g., MetaMask, WalletConnect) into the application for user authentication and transaction signing.
subtasks.details: Implement wallet provider selection, UI prompts, and provider injection into the SDK.

subtasks.title: Wallet Connect Flow
subtasks.description: Develop the logic and UI for users to connect their wallets to the application.
subtasks.details: Handle user prompts, connection status, and error feedback for wallet connection attempts.

subtasks.title: Wallet Disconnect Flow
subtasks.description: Implement the ability for users to safely disconnect their wallets from the application.
subtasks.details: Clear session data, update UI, and handle edge cases such as abrupt disconnects.

subtasks.title: Node Connection Management
subtasks.description: Establish and manage connections to blockchain nodes, including failover and reconnection strategies.
subtasks.details: Configure RPC endpoints, monitor node health, and implement fallback mechanisms.

subtasks.title: Transaction Creation and Signing
subtasks.description: Develop the logic for creating, signing, and preparing transactions for submission to the blockchain.
subtasks.details: Support various transaction types, handle user approvals, and ensure secure signing via wallet.

subtasks.title: Transaction Submission and Monitoring
subtasks.description: Implement transaction broadcasting to the blockchain and monitor transaction status until confirmation.
subtasks.details: Handle transaction receipts, error states, and provide user feedback on transaction progress.

subtasks.title: Event Listener Implementation
subtasks.description: Set up event listeners for relevant blockchain events (e.g., transaction confirmations, account changes).
subtasks.details: Subscribe to smart contract events, wallet events, and node status updates.

subtasks.title: Multi-Signature Transaction Support
subtasks.description: Integrate multi-signature wallet logic, including transaction proposal, signature collection, and execution.
subtasks.details: Support multi-sig contract interactions, manage signature thresholds, and handle partial approvals.

subtasks.title: Key Management and Security
subtasks.description: Implement secure key management practices, including storage, encryption, and recovery mechanisms.
subtasks.details: Support hardware wallets, encrypted local storage, and backup/recovery flows.

subtasks.title: Edge Case and Security Testing
subtasks.description: Test all integration points for edge cases, security vulnerabilities, and failure scenarios.
subtasks.details: Include tests for network failures, invalid transactions, unauthorized access, and key compromise.

tasks.title: Real-time Communication with WebSockets
tasks.description: Implement real-time communication using WebSockets for live updates and notifications.
tasks.details:
1. Set up Socket.io server on the backend
2. Implement Socket.io client integration in Next.js frontend
3. Create WebSocket connection management with reconnection handling
4. Implement real-time notification system
5. Create live updates for challenge status changes
6. Set up real-time chat functionality for users
7. Implement WebSocket authentication and authorization
8. Create room-based communication for challenge-specific discussions
9. Set up presence indicators for online users
10. Implement typing indicators for chat functionality
11. Create WebSocket event logging for debugging
12. Implement connection pooling for WebSocket scalability
tasks.testStrategy: Test WebSocket connections with multiple clients simultaneously. Create unit tests for WebSocket event handlers. Implement integration tests for the complete notification flow. Test reconnection handling with network interruptions.

subtasks.title: Server Setup for Real-Time Communication
subtasks.description: Design and implement the server-side infrastructure to handle real-time connections, including protocol selection (e.g., WebSocket, WebRTC), session management, and message routing.
subtasks.details: Establish the foundational backend services and select appropriate frameworks or libraries for real-time data exchange. Ensure the server can handle concurrent connections and is extensible for additional features.

subtasks.title: Client Setup for Real-Time Communication
subtasks.description: Develop the client-side logic to connect to the real-time server, manage connection lifecycle, and handle incoming/outgoing messages.
subtasks.details: Implement client libraries or SDKs for connecting to the server, handling reconnections, and managing state changes in real-time.

subtasks.title: Authentication Mechanism
subtasks.description: Integrate secure authentication and authorization for both server and client to ensure only verified users can access real-time features.
subtasks.details: Implement token-based authentication (e.g., JWT), session validation, and access control checks for all real-time endpoints.

subtasks.title: Room Management
subtasks.description: Design and implement logic for creating, joining, leaving, and managing chat or communication rooms.
subtasks.details: Enable dynamic room creation, user assignment, and enforce room-level permissions and limits.

subtasks.title: Real-Time Chat Functionality
subtasks.description: Develop the core chat feature, enabling users to send and receive messages instantly within rooms.
subtasks.details: Implement message broadcasting, message history, and delivery acknowledgments to ensure reliable communication.

subtasks.title: Notification System
subtasks.description: Implement real-time notifications for events such as new messages, user joins/leaves, and system alerts.
subtasks.details: Design a notification delivery mechanism that supports both in-app and push notifications, with user preferences and throttling.

subtasks.title: Presence and Activity Indicators
subtasks.description: Add real-time indicators for user presence (online/offline), typing status, and read receipts.
subtasks.details: Track and broadcast user activity states efficiently to all relevant clients in a scalable manner.

tasks.title: Zero-Knowledge Proof Implementation
tasks.description: Implement Zero-Knowledge Proofs for location verification, timestamp validation, and privacy-preserving user verification.
tasks.details:
1. Research and select appropriate ZKP libraries (e.g., snarkjs, circom)
2. Implement location verification ZKP circuits
3. Create timestamp validation ZKP circuits
4. Set up data integrity proofs without revealing content
5. Implement privacy-preserving user verification
6. Create ZKP verification system on the backend
7. Set up trusted execution environment (TEE) integration
8. Implement ZKP generation on the frontend
9. Create proof submission and validation workflow
10. Set up ZKP caching for performance optimization
11. Implement batch verification for multiple proofs
12. Create ZKP-based audit trail for verification history
tasks.testStrategy: Test ZKP generation and verification with various inputs. Create unit tests for ZKP circuits. Implement integration tests for the complete proof submission and verification flow. Test performance with large numbers of proofs.

subtasks.title: Survey and Evaluate ZKP Libraries
subtasks.description: Research and compare available zero-knowledge proof libraries and frameworks for suitability, performance, and compatibility.
subtasks.details: Consider general-purpose ZKP frameworks, their underlying arithmetic, supported proof systems, and community support.

subtasks.title: Select ZKP Library
subtasks.description: Choose the most appropriate ZKP library based on the evaluation criteria and project requirements.
subtasks.details: Document the rationale for selection, including trade-offs in proof size, setup, scalability, and security assumptions.

subtasks.title: Define ZKP Use Cases and Requirements
subtasks.description: Specify the privacy-preserving verification scenarios and the statements to be proven in zero-knowledge.
subtasks.details: Clarify whether interactive or non-interactive ZKPs are needed, and outline completeness, soundness, and zero-knowledge requirements.

subtasks.title: Design ZKP Circuits
subtasks.description: Translate the verification logic into arithmetic circuits or constraint systems compatible with the selected ZKP library.
subtasks.details: Ensure the circuit design captures all required constraints and is optimized for efficiency and security.

subtasks.title: Implement and Test ZKP Circuits
subtasks.description: Develop and validate the designed circuits, ensuring correctness and adherence to zero-knowledge properties.
subtasks.details: Use test vectors and edge cases to verify circuit behavior and proof generation/verification.

subtasks.title: Integrate ZKP Backend
subtasks.description: Embed the ZKP prover and verifier logic into the backend system, enabling proof generation and verification workflows.
subtasks.details: Ensure secure handling of secrets and efficient communication between backend components.

subtasks.title: Integrate ZKP Frontend
subtasks.description: Connect the frontend application to the backend ZKP services, enabling user interaction with privacy-preserving features.
subtasks.details: Design UI/UX for proof submission, verification results, and error handling.

subtasks.title: Integrate Trusted Execution Environment (TEE)
subtasks.description: Incorporate TEE support to securely execute sensitive ZKP operations and protect cryptographic secrets.
subtasks.details: Evaluate TEE options (e.g., Intel SGX, ARM TrustZone) and ensure compatibility with ZKP backend.

subtasks.title: Implement Caching for ZKP Proofs
subtasks.description: Design and implement a caching mechanism to store and reuse ZKP proofs where appropriate, improving performance.
subtasks.details: Define cache invalidation policies and ensure cache does not compromise privacy or security.

subtasks.title: Implement Batch Verification
subtasks.description: Develop batch verification logic to efficiently verify multiple ZKP proofs simultaneously.
subtasks.details: Optimize for scalability and minimize computational overhead in high-throughput scenarios.

subtasks.title: Develop Audit Trail Mechanism
subtasks.description: Create an audit trail system to log ZKP-related events for compliance, debugging, and monitoring.
subtasks.details: Ensure logs do not leak sensitive information and support traceability of proof generation and verification.

subtasks.title: Security Review and Compliance Audit
subtasks.description: Conduct a comprehensive security review and compliance audit of the ZKP implementation, including TEE, caching, and audit trail.
subtasks.details: Assess against advanced security goals, such as protection against malicious provers/verifiers and formal zero-knowledge guarantees.
